text:
The pizza is terrible, but if you need a place to watch a game or just down some pitchers, this place works.

Oh, and the pasta is even worse than the pizza.
Food here is very consistent and good for a quick lunch or dinner. I usually order the garlic bread and salad; however, their pizza, especially the bbq chicken, is pretty good too.

Meh.

I got the Chicken Parmesan. The noodles and sauce both seemed to be sub-par quality. Chicken wasn't too bad though. I wish I would have gotten pizza or something, but I thought the Chicken Parm would be better.

The place is well decorated, however. So that was nice. 

It's convenient. But it's college food and not at its best.

A cheap place to stop in and get lunch if you have class on the north side.  I miss the other location.  A lot of times they will have a lunch special available and it's in your best interest to take advantage of it when you're tired of eating Fat Slice.

I come here every few months, usually to see a show at Impact Theater (their space is in La Val's basement).  The pizza is OK, though not spectacular.  Last week, my wife & I ordered a medium LaVal's special (Pepperoni, Salami, Linguica, Beef, Black Olives, Sausage, Mushrooms, Bell Peppers and Onions).  It was good and filling, but I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here if it wasn't for the shows.

During the school year, the place is very busy with students on Friday and Saturday nights.  But there is seating outdoors if the weather is nice.

I don't like La Val's. the pizza here is just not very good. The pasta dishes are meh and personally I've had better. They're a good place for college students but I don't like eating here. I try to avoid it. 

The only thing they got going for them is the place is awesome. Sitting inside is nice, its a bit loud especially during big games. It's got large booths and plenty of space for big large groups including post review session hang outs.

I like thin crust pizza, and la val's has the thinnest crust in berkeley! Their creative toppings and pizza combinations are really worth trying! If you are a pizza lover, you'll like this place! It's definitely worth making a trip out here to try their pizza! And if you are lazy, get it delivered :)  (FREE DELIVERY!! YAY for LAZY PEOPLE!!)

If you're on the north side of campus and want a quick lunch and don't want La Burrita, this is the place to go! This place is also good for group dinners too. They sell pizzas by the slice, and have lots of variety. I really like the Athenian slice! The pizzas can take a while to come out though

Their margherita pizza is great! Don't get their pastas--they're badly made, I can make way better pasta. There's sports on and a pool table. The prices are good but unfortunately there's no discount for buying in bulk really.

Decent pizza place. Great for groups b/c it's so spacious. It's a step above the sketchy Fat Slice and Blondie's. I like their combo pizzas, but after having tasted more gourmet pizzas like Zachary's and Cheeseboard's, you'd never go back to La Val's. I mainly went there for convenience after slaving over a stubborn program in Soda Hall, back in the college days...

I think they have the best pizza in Berkeley!  But get there before lunch because the line goes out the door. The price is unbeatable, $2.50 for a slice and a soda and their thin crust it deeelish!!  mmmmm...  the margharita slice is my favorite! They put tons of garlic!

This is a nice La Val's. It has big screen TVs playing sports and a pool table in the back. The pizza is just ok as always, but the garlic bread is delicious. 

Back in the days it was nice to take a break from the dreariness of Soda Hall have dinner, and play a game of pool, before going back to program.
